name: Dr Man Ho Allen Au
personal background: <Dr. Man Ho Allen Au is a Full Professor at the Department of Computing of The Hong Kong Polytechnic University. Before that, he was an Associate Professor in the Department of Computer Science at the University of Hong Kong. Allen's research interests include Information Security, Applied Cryptography, Blockchain Technology, and their applications. He has been ranked as HKU Scholar in the Top 1% (by Clarivate Analytics in the top 1% worldwide by citations) in 2020 - 2022. He is also listed as the World's Top 2% Scientists by single-year impact and by career-long impact in the list published by Stanford University in Oct 2022. His research has generated significant social and economic impact. In the past 5 years, he as the principal investigator has attracted over HK$30M in research and high-level consultancy projects. He is currently an associate editor of IEEE Transactions on Dependable and Secure Computing, Journal of Information Security and Applications, and an editorial board member of Journal of Cryptologic Research.> <Man Ho Au is a researcher with expertise in cryptography, blockchain, and cybersecurity. He has published numerous papers in top-tier conferences and journals, including IEEE Transactions on Mobile Computing, International Journal of Information Security, and IEEE Transactions on Dependable and Secure Computing. He has also served as a member of the Professional Services Committee for the Hong Kong Blockchain Society R&D division and an expert member for ISO/IEC JTC 1/SC 27 WG 2 - Cryptography and Security Mechanisms. Additionally, he has trained training on blockchain technology for OGCIO from June 2019 to June 2020.]
